title: Israeli strikes in Lebanon and Gaza leave 27 dead - World
message:
BEIRUT: At least 27 people, including two children, were killed in Israeli air strikes, with around 10 fatalities in Nabatieh, south Lebanon, and at least 17 in the Gaza town of Zawayda, according to health officials.
The Israeli military said the airstrike targeted a weapons depot used by Hezbollah fighters.
The Israeli strike came after ceasefire talks between Palestinian Islamist group Hamas and Israel in Doha paused on Friday with negotiators due to meet again next week.
Two soldiers were wounded in a rocket attack from Lebanon, the Israeli military said, adding that a total of 55 rockets had been fired in latest strikes from Lebanon.
Also on Saturday, an Israeli drone targeted a motorcycle in the Qadmous area east of Tyre in south Lebanon, NNA reported, adding that one person was injured.

title: WATCH : Israeli Drone Strike Eliminates Two Senior Hamas Operatives in Jenin
message:
This evening, an Israeli drone strike in the West Bank city of Jenin killed two senior Hamas operatives, as confirmed by both the IDF and Shin Bet security agency.
Abu Ara, identified as a key figure in multiple terror attacks and the production of explosive devices, and Dawasi, a senior member of Hamas’ local network in Jenin, were struck while traveling in a vehicle.
Hamas later confirmed the deaths, stating that Dawasi served as a commander in the group’s Jenin wing, while Abu Ara held a senior operational role.
The IDF and Shin Bet attribute several recent attacks to the two, including a deadly roadside bombing in Jenin on June 27, another bombing against Defense Ministry workers on July 23, and the recent terror shooting in the Jordan Valley.
Footage of the strike has been released by the military.

title: Israel : Israeli airstrike in Gaza kills 18 family members amid cease - fire talks
message:
An Israeli airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people from the same family on Saturday.
They stated that attacks on militants in central Gaza were ongoing.In addition to the airstrike, another mass evacuation was ordered for parts of central Gaza.
Israeli military spokesperson Avichay Adraee, in a post on X, cited Palestinian rocket fire and advised Palestinians in and around the urban Maghazi refugee camp to evacuate.
"The suffering began from the day we left our homes," said Ahmad Omrani, one of those affected by the evacuation order.
The local health ministry confirmed that two bodies were taken to a government hospital.

title: Ukraine updates : More advances in Kursk , says Kyiv – DW – 08 / 18 / 2024
message:
08/18/2024 August 18, 2024 Chechnya's Kadyrov boasts of Tesla truckChechen leader Ramzan Kadyrov boasted of having a Cyberbeast luxury truck from US carmaker Tesla.
"A truly invulnerable and fast animal," Kadyrov said in a post on the Telegram messaging service.
Kadyrov thanked Tesla CEO Elon Musk and invited him to Chechnya.
"I express my sincere gratitude to Elon Musk!
"I am sure this 'beast' will be of great use to our fighters," he said, referring to soldiers fighting in Ukraine.

title: Israeli airstrike targeting Hamas vehicle in West Bank kills two terrorists
message:
Israel said it killed two senior Hamas terrorists in an airstrike on their car in Jenin in the occupied West Bank on Saturday, claiming they were involved in the killing of an Israeli.
The Israeli statement said the two terrorists were involved in planning a shooting attack last week in the West Bank's Jordan Valley where an Israeli man, Yonatan Deutsch, was killed.
Israeli authorities said then that Palestinian gunmen opened fire on a main road in the occupied West Bank on Aug. 11, killing one and wounding another.
The latest West Bank violence comes as a new round of talks in Doha aimed at ending 10 months of fighting in Gaza are due to resume next week.
The Gaza war and escalating West Bank violence threaten to spill into a wider regional conflict involving Iran and its proxies in the region, including Hezbollah in Lebanon and the Houthis in Yemen.

The two terrorists eliminated in an airstrike in Jenin last night have both been identified as senior terrorists and partners in the shooting attack that killed Yehonatan Deutsch.
Moreover, he served as a senior figure involved in the production of explosives for terror purposes.
Rafat Dowasi from Silat al-Harithiya is a senior figure in Hamas's military infrastructure in the Jenin area.
In the last week, the IDF and ISA have been working on intelligence in the Jenin area, following the shooting attack in the Jordan Valley in which Deutsch was murdered.
According to assessments, the cell came from Jenin and managed to escape after the attack towards the northern Samaria area.

title: Israeli airstrike in West Bank kills two senior Hamas fighters
message:
RAMALLAH, WEST BANK, Aug 17: Israel conducted an airstrike on Saturday in Jenin, located in the occupied West Bank, killing two senior Hamas fighters.
Hamas' Al-Qassam Brigades confirmed the deaths, mourning the loss of the two fighters targeted in the airstrike.
The Israeli military stated that the fighters were responsible for the attack on 11 August, where Palestinian gunmen opened fire on a main road in the occupied West Bank, killing Deutsch and wounding another individual.
Hamas indicated that this operation was in retaliation for an Israeli airstrike on a school in Gaza City, which had killed at least 90 displaced Palestinians.
The violence in the West Bank has escalated following the outbreak of war in Gaza between Israel and Hamas in October.

title: An Israeli airstrike kills 18 members of a family in Gaza as mediators hope for a cease - fire - WSVN 7News | Miami News , Weather , Sports
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people, all from the same family, on Saturday, hours after mediators expressed optimism for an imminent cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas after 10 months of war.
Among those killed was Sami Jawad al-Ejlah, a wholesaler who coordinated with the Israeli military to bring meat and fish to Gaza.
The Israeli military, which rarely comments on individual strikes, said it struck “terrorist infrastructure” in central Gaza where rockets had been fired toward Israel in recent weeks.
Around 110 are believed to be in Gaza, though Israeli authorities believe around a third are dead.
An Israeli strike Saturday killed at least 10 Syrians, including a woman and her two children, Lebanon’s Health Ministry said.

title: Israel - Palestine war : Airstrike kills 18 people from one family in central Gaza
message:
An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people – all from the same family – and another strike killed 10 people in Lebanon on Saturday, hours after mediators expressed optimism for an imminent ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas after 10 months of war.
At least 18 Palestinians – all from the same family – were killed by fresh Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, according to authorities.
Credit: APThe mediation efforts aim to secure the release of scores of Israeli hostages and stop the fighting that has devastated Gaza, where the death toll has surpassed 40,000 and a possible polio outbreak is feared.
Talks are also meant to calm regional tensions that have threatened to explode into a wider war if Iran and Hezbollah militants in Lebanon attack Israel in retaliation for recent killings of militant leaders.
Saturday’s airstrike in central Gaza hit a house and an adjacent warehouse sheltering displaced people at the entrance to the town of Zawaida, according to the al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Deir al-Balah, where casualties were taken.

title: Israel - Palestine war : Airstrike kills 18 people from one family in central Gaza
message:
An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people – all from the same family – and another strike killed 10 people in Lebanon on Saturday, hours after mediators expressed optimism for an imminent ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas after 10 months of war.
At least 18 Palestinians – all from the same family – were killed by fresh Israeli airstrikes in Gaza, according to authorities.
Credit: APThe mediation efforts aim to secure the release of scores of Israeli hostages and stop the fighting that has devastated Gaza, where the death toll has surpassed 40,000 and a possible polio outbreak is feared.
Talks are also meant to calm regional tensions that have threatened to explode into a wider war if Iran and Hezbollah militants in Lebanon attack Israel in retaliation for recent killings of militant leaders.
Saturday’s airstrike in central Gaza hit a house and an adjacent warehouse sheltering displaced people at the entrance to the town of Zawaida, according to the al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in Deir al-Balah, where casualties were taken.

title: At least 18 killed in Israeli airstrike on Gaza as more evacuations ordered
message:
An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people, all from the same family, on Saturday, hours after mediators expressed optimism for a possible cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas following 10 months of war.
Among those killed was Sami Jawad al-Ejlah, a wholesaler who coordinated with the Israeli military to bring meat and fish to Gaza.
Meanwhile, an Israeli strike Saturday in southern Lebanon killed at least 10 Syrians, including a woman and her two children, Lebanon's Health Ministry said.
Israeli military spokesperson Avichay Adraee in a post on X cited Palestinian rocket fire and said Palestinians in areas in and around the urban Maghazi refugee camp should leave.
The health ministry there said two bodies were taken to a government hospital.

title: Israeli strikes in Gaza and Lebanon kill at least 25 , officials say
message:
In southern Lebanon, a strike on what local officials said was a metal warehouse killed 10 people, including a Syrian woman and her two children, the health ministry said.
The death toll appeared to be the highest in a single attack in Lebanon since Hezbollah and Israel began trading fire after the October 7 Hamas-led attacks on southern Israel.
The deaths brought the toll on civilians in Lebanon to 125 since October, according to a Washington Post tally.
In Israel, 24 civilians have been killed in attacks by Hezbollah, Israeli officials said.
A Hezbollah statement said it was the first time the area had been targeted.

title: Ukraine says it repelled Russian missile attack on capital
message:
Ukrainian forces said they thwarted a Russian missile attack on the capital Kyiv where air raid sirens sounded before dawn on Sunday.
"This is the third ballistic missile attack on the capital in August with a clear interval of six days between each attack," the Kyiv City Military Administration posted on Telegram after the early morning barrage.
Simultaneous to the missile attack, drones were spotted heading to Kyiv.
Last weekend, a 35-year-old man and his four-year-old son were killed in an overnight Russian missile attack near Kyiv.
Ukraine claims to have seized more than 1,100 square kilometres of Russian territory in the biggest attack by a foreign army on Russian soil since World War II.

title: Israeli strike kills at least 17 Palestinians in central Gaza , health officials say
message:
CAIRO/GAZA — At least 17 Palestinians were killed and dozens wounded in an Israeli strike in the central Gaza town of Zawayda on Saturday (Aug 17), health officials said, as Israel issued new evacuation orders, citing Hamas rocket fire nearby.
Most of the people killed in Zawayda were from the same family and they included eight children and four women, according to health officials in the Hamas-administered enclave.
The Israeli military said in response it had struck militant targets in an area from which rockets were fired at its troops.
The Israeli military said that since Friday its forces had killed dozens of militants, including some who had fired rockets from central and southern Gaza.
Israel's subsequent military campaign has killed more than 40,000 Palestinians, most of them civilians, according to Gaza health authorities.

title: Russia launches third missile attack on Kyiv in month
message:
Ukrainian service personnel use a searchlight as they search for drones in the sky over the city during a Russian drone strike, amid Russia's attack on Ukraine, in Kyiv, Ukraine August 16, 2024.
PHOTO:REUTERSRussia launched on Sunday its third ballistic missile on Kyiv in August, with preliminary data showing that all the air weapons were destroyed on their approach to the city, the military administration of the Ukrainian capital said.
"This is already the third ballistic strike on the capital in August, with exact intervals of six days between each attack," Serhiy Popko, the head of the Kyiv military administration, said on the Telegram messaging app.
Popko added that Ukraine's air defence units also destroyed a number of drones launched by Russia.
About two hours after the initial attack, Kyiv, its surrounding region and most of central and northeast Ukraine were under fresh raid alerts, with threats of more missiles heading towards the city, Ukraine's air force said.

title: Kyiv Comes Under Ballistic Missile Attack Sunday Morning
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) For the third time in August, the Russians attacked Kyiv using ballistic missiles.
That's according to the Kyiv Regional Military Administration , Ukrinform reports.
"This morning, around 05:00, the enemy launched a ballistic missile attack on Kyiv.
Besides the ballistic missiles, Russia also launched one-way attack UAVs also targeting Kyiv.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, a ballistic missile alert went off in Kyiv and a number of Ukrainian regions this morning.

title: Russia launches third ballistic missile attack on Kyiv this month , Ukraine says By Reuters
message:
KYIV (Reuters) -Russia on Sunday carried out its third ballistic missile attack on Kyiv this month but preliminary data indicated most of the projectiles were shot down on approach, the military administration of the Ukrainian capital said.
Popko said the Russians had most likely used North Korean-made ballistic missiles.
He said Russia launched eight missiles on Sunday morning, including three ballistic, three cruise and two guided aircraft missiles.
However, Kyiv region governor Ruslan Kravchenko said two private houses were destroyed and 16 others were damaged by falling debris.
Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine two-and-a-half years ago and now holds about 18 percent of its territory in the east and south.

title: Russians target Kyiv again this morning , launching cruise missiles in second attack
message:
Russians target Kyiv again this morning, launching cruise missiles in second attackRussian forces have launched yet another attack on Kyiv with cruise missiles at around 07:00, just two hours after attempting to deliver a ballistic missile strike.
Ukrainian air defence units have destroyed all the targets.
Source: Serhii Popko, Head of Kyiv City Military AdministrationDetails: Early reports indicate that the Russians used Iskander-K-type missiles, which undertook long, complex manoeuvres across several Ukrainian oblasts before attempting to strike targets on the southern front.
Ukrainian air defence assets and personnel have shot down all the targets.
Quote from Popko: "We are grateful to the air defence personnel for their reliable protection.

title: Two Palestinians Killed In Israeli Attack In West Bank : Sources
message:
(MENAFN- IANS) Ramallah Aug 18 (IANS) At least two Palestinians were killed and another in an Israeli drone strike on a vehicle in Jenin, northern West Bank, as per Palestinian and Israeli sources.
The statement identified one of the deceased as Raafat Dawasi, 28, while the identity of the second body remains unknown.
Wissam Bakar, Director of Jenin government hospital, told Xinhua that medical teams had difficulty identifying the bodies because they were delivered as charred remains.
Bakar added that one person sustained moderate injuries from shrapnel, and was transported to the hospital for treatment.
Since October 7, 2023, the West Bank has witnessed escalating tension and armed confrontations in various cities, villages, and camps, leading to the deaths of more than 630 Palestinians, according to Palestine's health ministry.

title: Terror shook Finland five summers ago but one man bravery is what we should remember | World News
message:
She had come from Syria to Finland as a refugee and knew Bouanane from studying on the same Finnish language course.
Violence in Finland Compared with international crime rates, Finland is regarded as a safe country, especially when it comes to random acts of violence.
But the militant group has never claimed responsibility for the Turku attack.
On the day of the attack Bouanane visited a mosque and recorded a video in which he spoke of the US-led air strikes against the Islamic State in Syria.
He had scribbled in his notes that he wanted to establish an Islamic state in Finland, Ilta-Sanomat reported.

title: Russia launches third ballistic missile attack on Kyiv this month , Ukraine says
message:
KYIV — Russia launched on Sunday (Aug 18) its third ballistic missile on Kyiv in August, with preliminary data showing that all the air weapons were destroyed on their approach to the city, the military administration of the Ukrainian capital said.
"According to preliminary information, the Russians again, for the third time in a row, most likely used North Korean ballistic missiles."
Popko added that Ukraine's air defence units also destroyed a number of drones launched by Russia.
Reuters could not independently verify the type of missiles launched.
About two hours after the initial attack, Kyiv, its surrounding region and most of central and northeast Ukraine were under fresh raid alerts, with threats of more missiles heading towards the city, Ukraine's air force said.

message:
"This is already the third ballistic strike on the capital in August, with exact intervals of six days between each attack," Serhiy Popko, the head of the Kyiv military administration, said on the Telegram messaging app.

Popko said there were no immediate reports of casualties or damage.Reuters could not independently verify the type of missiles launched.
(Reporting by Valentyn Ogirenko in Kyiv; Writing by Lidia Kelly in Melbourne; Editing by Jamie Freed)

Popko said the Russians had most likely used North Korean-made ballistic missiles.
He said Russia launched eight missiles on Sunday morning, including three ballistic, three cruise and two guided aircraft missiles.
However, Kyiv region governor Ruslan Kravchenko said two private houses were destroyed and 16 others were damaged by falling debris.

message:
"This is already the third ballistic strike on the capital in August, with exact intervals of six days between each attack," Serhiy Popko, the head of the Kyiv military administration, said on the Telegram messaging app.

title: Lebanon says 10 Syrians killed in Israeli strike on south
message:
BEIRUT, Lebanon — The Lebanese health ministry said an Israeli air strike on the south on Saturday killed 10 Syrians, as the Israeli military reported hitting weapons stores of the Iran-backed Hezbollah movement.
The Israeli military said there were no reports of any casualties but the 55 rockets sparked "multiple fires".
Earlier, the Israeli military said a "projectile" fired from Lebanon had wounded two soldiers, one of them severely, near Misgav Am, a kibbutz community close to the border.
The cross-border violence has killed 581 people in Lebanon, mostly Hezbollah fighters but including at least 128 civilians, according to an AFP tally.
On the Israeli side, including in the annexed Golan Heights, 22 soldiers and 26 civilians have been killed, according to army figures.

title: Israeli airstrike kills 18 members of a family in Gaza
message:
DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip — An Israel airstrike in Gaza killed at least 18 people, all from the same family, on Saturday — hours after mediators expressed optimism for an imminent cease-fire deal between Israel and Hamas.
Officials from the United States, Egypt and Qatar ended two days of cease-fire talks and expressed hope that a deal could be reached in the 10-month-old war.
Among those killed was Sami Jawad al-Ejlah, a wholesaler who coordinated with the Israeli military to bring meat and fish to Gaza.
The Israeli military, which rarely comments on individual strikes, said it struck "terrorist infrastructure" in central Gaza where rockets were fired toward Israel in recent weeks.
The vast majority of Gaza's population was displaced, often multiple times, and about 84% of the territory was put under evacuation orders by the Israeli military, according to the United Nations.

title: Russia Ukraine war live : Kyiv  blows up  second bridge in Kursk as Putin hits back with missiles attack on capital
message:

Please try again later {{ /verifyErrors }}Ukraine’s armed forces says it has attacked a second bridge in Russia’s Kursk region, over Seym river in which another bridge was destroyed earlier this week.
Air force commander Lieutenant General Mykola Oleshchuk wrote: “Minus one more bridge!
Rostov governor Vasily Golubev said firefighters were called to put out the fire at the damaged oil depot.
Meanwhile, the International Atomic Energy Agency warned of “deteriorating safety” at Europe’s largest nuclear power facility in Ukraine, which was seized by Moscow in the early days of its full-scale invasion.

title: Safety at Ukraine power plant  deteriorating  after drone strike threatens disaster at ...
message:
Safety at Ukraine power plant 'deteriorating' after drone strike threatens disaster at Europe's largest nuclear facilitySafety at Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia power plant 'deteriorating' after drone strike threatens disaster at Europe's largest nuclear facility.
Picture: AlamyBy Christian OliverThe safety of Europe's largest nuclear facility is under threat after the United Nation's watchdog warned that the situation at Ukraine’s Zaporizhzhia power plant is “deteriorating” after a nearby drone strike.
A Russian soldier standing in front of the Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Power Plant in Enerhodar, Zaporizhzhia Oblast.
The fire caused “considerable damage” but there was no significant threat to nuclear safety, the agency confirmed.
Russian military bloggers said that the destruction of bridges would impede deliveries of supplies to Russian forces, but not cut them off completely.

title: Tyranny and turmoil  in Russian invasion , US defense secretary says
message:
Austin made the remarks at the annual Halifax International Security Forum, which attracts defense and security officials from Western democracies.
“Russia’s invasion offers a preview of a possible world of tyranny and turmoil that none of us would want to live in.
U.S. Secretary of Defense Lloyd J. Austin III delivers remarks at the Halifax International Security Forum in Halifax on Saturday, Nov.19, 2022.
While the source of the missile is under investigation, NATO officials have said they suspect it was fired from a Ukrainian missile battery.
Russian officials have cast the conflict as a struggle against NATO — though Ukraine is not a NATO member even if it has been receiving aid from NATO member states.

title: Israel deterrence is working against Iran Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
message:
The answer just might be “yes,” as revealed by a barely reported yet enormously dramatic statement from Iran’s new elected President Masoud Pezeshkian.
The message was becoming clear: Israel can strike Iran, Lebanon, and anywhere else.
AFTER THE recent strike in Tehran, Iran vowed to perform its “duty” of “avenging [Haniyeh’s] blood,” including what appears to be a threat to intentionally target Israeli civilians.
Instead, the Iranian president cited fears of Israeli retaliation.
Specifically, Pezeshkian cautioned that an Israeli retaliatory attack could cripple Iran’s economy, infrastructure, and even lead to the country’s collapse.

title: Blinken to arrive in Israel to push for Gaza ceasefire as Hamas dismisses optimism
message:
View image in fullscreen A Palestinian man grieves for relatives killed by an Israeli strike, at the Aal-Aqsa Martyrs hospital in Deir el-Balah, central Gaza.
Photograph: Majdi Fathi/NurPhoto/REX/ShutterstockIn Israel, Blinken is expected to meet with Israeli prime minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other senior officials.
Iran has threatened to retaliate against Israel after the assassination of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran on 31 July.
Israel’s negotiating team on Saturday expressed “cautious optimism” on the possibility of advancing a deal, according to a statement on Saturday from Netanyahu’s office.
Even as hopes grew for a ceasefire, Israel continued its deadly assault on Gaza.

title: Ukrainian military compensate for Russia superiority in manpower and equipment by manoeuvring in Kursk Oblast – ISW
message:
Ukrainian military compensate for Russia's superiority in manpower and equipment by manoeuvring in Kursk Oblast – ISWUkraine's operation in Kursk Oblast illustrates how Ukrainian forces can use manoeuvre warfare to compensate for Russia's superiority in manpower and equipment.
At the start of the Ukrainian operation in Kursk Oblast, the Ukrainian forces struck largely unprepared, ill-equipped, and undermanned Russian defensive positions along the border.
Even after Russian reinforcements were brought in, Ukraine continued to use manoeuvres to secure rapid gains in Kursk Oblast.
Ukraine's incursion into Kursk Oblast illustrates how Ukrainian forces can use manoeuvre warfare to offset Russian manpower and material advantages.
Ukrainian forces advanced within Chasiv Yar, and Russian forces recently marginally advanced near Kreminna, Pokrovsk, and Donetsk City.

title: Editorial : Ukraine incursion may tip war into a stalemate , with Russia already on the back foot
message:
Aleader is a dealer in hope, Napoleon said, but the success of Ukraine’s lightning incursion into Russia so far is likely to have gone beyond even president Volody­myr Zelensky’s expectations.
The Kremlin has sought to present the biggest war in seven decades on continental Europe as a limited “special military operation”.
But the sight of so many thousands of people being put on the move within Russia does not fit such a reassuring scenario.
A foothold in Russia would give Kyiv leverage in any such settlement talks.
When you control the media and have the opposition muzzled, a stalemate might easily be presented as a win.

title: Vietnam war : The Australians finding the bodies of fallen Vietnamese soldiers
message:
The Australians held their position in the treeline overlooking a dried-up swamp, 40 kilometres north-east of what then was called Saigon, as the North Vietnamese charged.
Luke Johnston at the mass grave he discovered in an old bomb crater at the site of the battle of Balmoral.
John Bryant embraces the sisters of North Vietnamese soldier Nguyen Van Ha, who Bryant believes he may have killed in 1968.
John Bryant salutes a casket holding the remains of North Vietnamese soldiers he fought at the Battle of Balmoral.
Australian veterans tried for more than a decade from the early part of this century to rediscover the spot, hoping to return the bodies of the North Vietnamese soldiers to their families for a proper burial.

title: Russia loses another 1 , 170 soldiers , seven tanks and 71 artillery systems
message:
Russia loses another 1,170 soldiers, seven tanks and 71 artillery systemsRussian troops lost 1,170 soldiers killed and wounded in the war of aggression against Ukraine over the past 24 hours, bringing the total number of personnel losses to 599,350.
Source: General Staff of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on FacebookDetails: The total combat losses of the Russian forces between 24 February 2022 and 18 August 2024 are estimated to be as follows [figures in parentheses represent the latest losses – ed.
]:Approximately 599,350 (+1,170) military personnel;8,508 (+7) tanks;16,480 (+7) armoured combat vehicles;17,056 (+71) artillery systems;1,161 (+1) multiple-launch rocket systems;923 (+0) air defence systems;367 (+0) fixed-wing aircraft;328 (+0) helicopters;13,752 (+38) strategic and tactical UAVs;2,432 (+0) cruise missiles;28 (+0) ships and boats;1 (+0) submarines;22,992 (+79) vehicles and tankers;2,846 (+2) special vehicles and other equipment.
The information is being confirmed.
Support UP or become our patron!

title: Alaseyori to fans : Pray For Me , evil forces trying to silence me
message:
Nigerian gospel singer Adeyinka Alaseyori has sparked concern among her fans after revealing that she is facing intense spiritual battles.
She called for prayers from her followers, claiming that malicious forces are trying to silence her voice and bring her down by all means.
Alaseyori, known for her soulful and energetic performances, opened up about the ongoing struggles she has been facing for months.
While Alaseyori remains a prominent figure in the gospel music industry, her meteoric rise has not been without controversy.
“I also want you to pray for yourselves too,” she urged, pointing out the ever-present spiritual battles that everyone faces.

title: Russian Troops Eliminate Group of 16 Ukrainian Soldiers in Kursk Region
message:
https://sputnikglobe.com/20240818/russian-troops-eliminate-group-of-16-ukrainian-military-in-kursk-region---spokesperson-1119810407.htmlRussian Troops Eliminate Group of 16 Ukrainian Soldiers in Kursk RegionRussian Troops Eliminate Group of 16 Ukrainian Soldiers in Kursk RegionSputnik InternationalA group of 16 Ukrainian military personnel of a separate mechanized brigade has been destroyed near the village of Kremyanoe in Russia's Kursk Region, a spokesperson for the Russian law enforcement department told Sputnik on Sunday.
2024-08-18T07:09+00002024-08-18T07:09+00002024-08-18T09:40+0000russia's special operation in ukrainerussiavladimir putinkurskukrainerussian defense ministryhigh mobility artillery rocket system (himars)https://cdn1.img.sputnikglobe.com/img/07e8/07/0a/1119326415_0:86:2622:1561_1920x0_80_0_0_6e84828a3955e0213e2dd81877e2391b.jpg"A group of 16 soldiers from the 225th Separate Assault Battalion of the 115th Separate Mechanized Brigade of the Ukrainian Army was destroyed near the settlement of Kremyanoe in the Kursk region.
The enemy unit was destroyed by Russian troops in the forest," the spokesperson said.On August 6, Ukrainian forces crossed the border into Russia and launched an offensive in the Kursk Region.
Commenting on the attack, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that Ukraine had carried out another large-scale provocation, firing indiscriminately at civilian targets.

title: Russia May Receive Iranian Analogue of HIMARS – Fath - 360
message:
The Kremlin has shown interest in Iranian ballistic missiles such as Fateh-110 and Zolfaghar as early as in 2022.
The Fath-360 is a tactical ballistic missile, which, unlike other ballistic missiles, has aa relatively short range.
In terms of concept, Ababil missiles are similar to the GMLRS guided missiles used in the HIMARS systems.
Fath-360The Iranian Fath-360 ballistic missile, also known as the BM-120, is 5.1 meters long, 368 mm in diameter, and weighs 787 kg, of which 150 kg is the warhead.
In accordance with the Iranian practice of masking military equipment, the launcher for the Fath-360 missile launcher is disguised as an ordinary civilian truck.

title: The Zionist policy of enrichment : Successes and failures
message:
To take a recent example, after Putin’s invasion of Ukraine in 2022, the West instantly minimized trade with Russia to weaken its war effort.
The Zionist movement and Israel, however, from the start adopted the opposite approach, seeking to enhance Palestinian economic welfare.
This, what I call the policy of enrichment, represents the deepest, most powerful, and most enduring of Israeli approaches to its Palestinian foe.
Founded on the assumption that Palestinian economic self-interest would push other concerns aside, enrichment hopes that gains in welfare will reconcile Palestinians to Jewish immigration and the creation of a Jewish homeland.
They must give up on managing their conflict and instead choose winning it.

title: Opinion : Red Thin Line – How to Play Russia
message:
Many of these lines have been crossed, most recently in a spectacular manner with Ukrainian forces entering Russian territory in the Kursk region.
This unexpected incursion into Russian territory sent an important message to the Russian people.
Seizing the NarrativeAfter Russia launched its full-scale invasion, there were attempts by Western politicians to seize control of the narrative.
It’s no secret that there is a significant qualitative gap between NATO forces and the Russian military.
The West should allow Ukraine to use all means necessary, including using the offensive weapons provided to it on Russian territory.

title: Family members of Michigan Civil War Veterans honor loved ones with Capitol flag procession
message:
LANSING, Mich. (WILX) -A special Michigan Civil War Battle flag Procession was held on Saturday, Aug. 17.
The flag procession was a way for people to honor and remember those from Michigan who lost their lives or fought in the Civil War.
Family members of those who fought in the war paraded 80 flags to the Michigan Capitol, where they returned them to their home lining inside the rotunda.
“These flags are a tangible link to our past and to Michigan’s incredible contribution during the Civil War,” said Matt Vanacker, Director for the Save the Flags Project.

message:

It combines an old-school feel with the modern git good games culture to give you a barbaric adventure you'll never forget.
Get ELDERBORN and immerse yourself in the action-filled, barbaric world waiting for those bold enough to answer the challenge.

Irish neutrality will be the focus of Co Wexford summer school debate
message:
In a special session at the Kennedy Summer School in New Ross this August, a spotlight will be shone on the topic of ‘The NATO Divide: Perspectives on Ireland’s Neutrality and National Security’.
Speaking ahead of the event Dr Stacey Connaughton said: “We will have an in-depth conversation with US Air Force Major General Timothy Zadalis (Ret.)
Questions remain about the viability of the neutrality of Austria and Ireland within the European Union.
Joining the panel discussion is Jim Roche who is PRO of the Irish Anti-War Movement and a founding member of the Irish Neutrality League.
The Kennedy Summer School and Festival is run in association with the Office of Public Works, Fáilte Ireland, New Ross District Council, Wexford County Council, Purdue University and Boston College.

title: New Spider - Man Skin Coming to Fortnite Soon
message:
A new Marvel-themed season is underway in Fortnite, and Chapter 5 Season 4 – Absolute Doom has a lot of great things to offer players who are also Marvel fans.
Per notable and historically reliable Fortnite leaker ShiinaBR, a new Spider-Man skin with the a high-tech suit taking inspiration from the original version of the Iron Spider suit will be hitting the Fortnite Shop next Friday, August 23rd.
In addition to the Iron Spider skin, the collaboration will also feature a skin, emote, pickaxe, guitar, and wrap, as was initally shared by another user, SpushFNBR.
The Iron Spider suit coming to Fortnite soon moves away from the Marvel Cinematic Universe for inspiration and instead embraces a visual a bit more familiar for the suit that's had multiple different versions since its initial debut in Amazing Spider-Man #529 (1999), where Tony Stark was first shown crafting the armor and gifting it to Peter Parker.
As mentioned, in the time since its initial debut the Iron Spider suit and title has been seen in many forms and worn by multiple different characters, from the MCU's Peter Parker portrayed by Tom Holland, to Mary Jane Watson putting on the armor in The Amazing Spider-Man #15 (2017), an Iron Spider suit in Insomniac's Marvel Spider-Man games, and more.

title: Russia War Casualty Toll In Ukraine Up By 1 , 170 In Past Day
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Since the full-scale invasion of Ukraine, Russian forces are believed to have lost 599,350 personnel killed or wounded, including 1,170 in the past 24 hours.
That's according to the General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces, Ukrinform reports.
No Russian warships spotted off Ukraine's coastsThe latest reports on enemy losses are being verified.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, Kyiv was targeted in yet another Russian ballistic attack Sunday morning.
No casualties were reported.

title: Bradford film highlights British soldier graves in Malakand | Bradford Telegraph and Argus
message:
But nestled among the wild shrubs are crosses and old gravestones, bearing the names of more than 100 British soldiers.
At least 2,000 Pakistani tribesmen and 233 British soldiers were killed in the conflict.
“The relevance of this area to British history is very important, but most people don’t know anything about it.
“The tribes people looking after this site are very poor Pakistani Pashtoons who, for 127 years, have respected those soldiers’ graves.
That shows respect and tolerance and it makes me very proud of them.”* Watch Forgotten British Soldiers Graveyard Pakistan at youtu.be/R_fnPo0SA-g?si=r6WhZSBlUY9twSsK

title: British Defence working  24 hours a day  to arm Ukraine for Russia push | World | News
message:
Exhausted UK technicians in Germany have been ordered to "keep the ammo flowing " to support Ukraine's effort in Russia.
And on Friday Russia's foreign ministry said Ukraine had used Western rockets to destroy a bridge over the Seym river in the Kursk region.
But London is also providing vital munitions, small arms and complex weapons systems for the effort, which has caught Moscow off-guard and boosted Kyiv’s leverage.
A “rolling conveyor belt” of military convoys is said to be trundling its way from a British depot in Germany to Ukraine.
This accompanied anti-tank missiles, artillery guns, air defence systems, armoured fighting vehicles, anti-structure munitions, and three M270 long-range multiple launch rocket systems.

title: 10 fantasy anime that every Lord of the Rings fan should watch | English Movie News
message:
Luckily, the anime world offers a treasure trove of fantasy tales that echo the epic journeys and grand battles found in Middle-earth.
After an untimely death, Kazuma Satou is reincarnated in a fantasy world where he’s joined by a quirky party of adventurers.
Like The Lord of the Rings, this anime explores the themes of destiny, redemption, and the passage of time, all within a beautifully crafted fantasy world.
The series follows a group of adventurers as they battle dark forces threatening the land of Lodoss.
The series offers a contemplative look at what happens after the epic adventure ends, making it a unique and thought-provoking experience for fantasy fans.

message:
The Mail on Sunday reports the Prime Minister’s dealings with unions over pay rises could cost the Government up to £14 billion.
The Sunday Express reports Chancellor Rachel Reeves “buried” a report detailing the consequences of culling fuel payments for some pensioners.
Work and Pensions Secretary Liz Kendall says Labour will end the “blame culture” surrounding people out of work, according to The Observer.

title: Dricus Du Plessis Beat Israel Adesanya Physically and Mentally at UFC 305
message:
Jeff Bottari/Zuffa LLCDricus Du Plessis is still the UFC middleweight champion, having beaten Israel Adesanya physically and mentally in one of the fiercest grudge matches in recent memory.
"I came here to die with this belt," Du Plessis told commentator Daniel Cormier shortly after Adesanya's tap-out.
Jeff Bottari/Zuffa LLC"At this level, it's hard to get people down," Du Plessis said.
As for Du Plessis, there's still plenty of work to be done.
As far as Du Plessis is concerned, however, the opponent doesn't matter.

title: US - based think - tank calls for establishing international administration in S Sudan
message:
An American think-tank has published a report calling for an international transitional administration established by the United Nations and the African Union to be placed over South Sudan.
The report pointed out that the civil war left South Sudan on the cusp of full-scale genocide, with its sovereignty discredited by warring elites.
She explained that the proposed international transitional administration would not necessitate an investment costlier than what the United States is already spending—more than $2 billion since 2013 (and more than $11 billion since 2005).
Knopf noted that similar efforts have previously succeeded in Bosnia and Herzegovina, Kosovo, East Timor, Cambodia, and Liberia.
The author emphasized that brokering such a transition will require committed diplomacy by the United States in close partnership with African governments.

title: Phone taps , sabotage and an assassination plot : Is Germany in Cold War 2 . 0 ?
message:
Phone taps, sabotage and an assassination plot: Is Germany in Cold War 2.0?
As a hot war rages between Russia and Ukraine, there are fears that Europe has slipped into a new Cold War.
“In some way, we’re in the early Cold War – the Fifties and Sixties, so a much rawer time.” But what does a rekindled Cold War look like for Europe’s biggest economy and a country that was once itself cut in half by the Iron Curtain?
So as Cold War comparisons hover over European security, the politics of that period has also renewed itself in Germany in a stark and unexpected way.

title: America Is the World Only Aircraft Carrier  Superpower
message:
-Notably, the first U.S. carrier was USS Langley, commissioned in 1922, while USS Enterprise became the first nuclear-powered carrier in 1961.
U.S. Navy Dominates with Over a Third of the World’s Aircraft CarriersIncluding amphibious assault ships (LHA), there are now 47 active aircraft carriers in the world, operated by fourteen navies.
The First Aircraft CarrierConverted from the collier USS Jupiter, USS Langley (CV-1, later AV-3) became the U.S. Navy's first aircraft carrier when she was commissioned in March 1922.
During the Second World War, 155 aircraft carriers were constructed, including 122 escort carriers.
First Nuclear CarrierCommissioned at Newport News, Virginia on November 25, 1961, USS Enterprise (CVN-65) became the first nuclear-powered aircraft carrier to enter service.

Just hours after Haniyeh was killed, Iran’s Supreme Leader, the Ayatollah Khamenei, ordered what the New York Post called “a direct strike” on Israel.
He is now even claiming that Allah will be angry if Iran doesn’t hit Israel.

title: This M * A * S * H Episode Proved That Sitcoms Can Break Our Hearts
message:
This time she’s revisiting an early M*A*S*H episode that showed just how much the classic sitcom was willing to blend comedy with deeply felt drama.
Despite its rebellious spirit, early M*A*S*H aimed to amuse above all else — until, suddenly, it didn’t.
We don’t know much about Tommy, but what we do know reveals that he’s as gleefully counter-cultural as his best pal.
M*A*S*H is full of gay jokes, but in a move that’s surprising for its time, they’re often more winking than homophobic.
“Do you?”“Sometimes You Hear The Bullet” is the first of countless emotional gut checks M*A*S*H would deliver over the years.

"People inside the United Center are the people who are going to be deciding our foreign policy in one way or another.
"We're going forward, full speed ahead," he said.The city has designated a park about a block from United Center for a speakers' stage.
"Pro-Palestinian protesters in Chicago have been highly visible, shutting down roads to the airport and staging sit-ins at congressional offices.
The 74-year-old now lives in Alabama but plans to come to Chicago to protest the war in Gaza.

title: Thousands of activists expected in Chicago for Democratic convention to call for Gaza ceasefire
message:
Thousands of activists are expected to converge in Chicago for the Democratic National Convention, hoping to call attention to abortion rights, economic justice and the war in GazaThousands of activists expected in Chicago for Democratic convention to call for Gaza ceasefireCHICAGO -- Thousands of activists are expected to converge on Chicago this week for the Democratic National Convention, hoping to call attention to abortion rights, economic injustice and the war in Gaza.
Demonstrations are expected every day of the convention and, while their agendas vary, many activists agree an immediate ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war is the priority.
Activists sued the city earlier this year, saying restrictions over where they can demonstrate violate their constitutional rights.
The convention will draw an estimated 50,000 people to the nation's third-largest city, including delegates, activists and journalists.
The 74-year-old now lives in Alabama but plans to come to Chicago to protest the war in Gaza.

title: Thousands of activists expected in Chicago for Democratic convention to call for Gaza ceasefire
message:
(AP Photo/Teresa Crawford)CHICAGO – Thousands of activists are expected to converge on Chicago this week for the Democratic National Convention, hoping to call attention to abortion rights, economic injustice and the war in Gaza.
Demonstrations are expected every day of the convention and, while their agendas vary, many activists agree an immediate ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war is the priority.
Later, the city agreed to allow demonstrations at a park and a march route closer to the United Center.
Security will be tight, with street closures around the convention center.
To combat traffic concerns, city leaders are touting a new $80 million train station steps from the United Center.

title: Man ends up paying just $14 for $14 , 000 Cartier earrings after brand website made a major blunder
message:
Man ends up paying just $14 for $14,000 Cartier earrings after brand website made a major blunderThe man came across the treasure scrolling on the internet while using the bathroomGetting a 99% discount from a luxury jeweler like Cartier is something that people can only dream of.
Earlier this year, Mexican Rogelio Villarreal bagged two Cartier earrings for a miraculous total of $28.
In a post on X, Villarreal shared the story of how he got the earrings so cheap.
There he noticed that 18-carat rose-gold Clash de Cartier earrings were on sale for just 237 Mexican Pesos or $13.91.
The earrings finally arrived on April 26, and Villarreal shared a nice picture of the boxes on X.

title: Russia reluctant to admit  the enemy is at the gate , treats incursion as natural disaster
message:
The Kremlin’s attempt to convey a sense of normality over the Ukrainian incursion is being replicated in state media.
The main topic wasn’t Ukraine ’s shock seizure of territory in Russia’s Kursk border region.
Putin said they would discuss “new technical solutions adopted during the special military operation,” Russia’s euphemism for its war in Ukraine, in a brief televised excerpt.
Authorities have also declared a state of emergency in the neighbouring Belgorod region, where officials report mounting cross-border attacks from Ukraine.
War-displaced people visit a church in Kursk on August 16, following Ukraine’s incursion into Russia’s Western Kursk region.

title: Trump Spends Rally Whining About Biden Exit , Harri Magazine Cover
message:
During Saturday’s rally, he still called Biden “crooked,” but he also went off teleprompter to claim that Biden “hates [Harris].
So he said he went back to look at the story, and wildly concluded: “I say that I am much better looking than her… I’m a better looking person than Kamala.”Trump: I am much better looking than her.
I'm a better looking person than Kamala.
pic.twitter.com/OdNA3mdtxj — Acyn (@Acyn) August 17, 2024Beyond his direct attacks on Harris, he also claimed that the “country is going to die” should he not be reelected.
Trump and Harris will also face-off in the state during their first debate on Sept. 10 in Philadelphia.

title: Nova film We Will Dance Again premiers at National Library - Israel Culture
message:
The National Library of Israel (NLI) opened its new building a few weeks after October 7 and has continued to operate throughout the conflict, so it’s fitting that it will present the ninth edition of the Docu.Text Festival, the Documentary Film Festival at the NLI, beginning on August 18.
More than 360 festivalgoers and staff were killed at the music and dance festival, about one in nine of those attending, and more than 40 were taken hostage, several of whom remain in Hamas captivity.
This film, which will be shown on television in Israel in late September on Hot 8, which is one of its producers, will also be widely shown internationally.
IN ADDITION to dealing with the war, the festival features many films on different aspects of literature, history, and religion, from Israel and around the world.
Certain films in the festival will be especially appropriate to see at the National Library.

title: No damage and casualties reported in morning missile and drone attack on Kyiv
message:
No damage and casualties reported in morning missile and drone attack on KyivThe Russians attacked Kyiv simultaneously with North Korean ballistic missiles and attack drones on the morning of 18 August.
Source: Serhii Popko, the Head of Kyiv Military Administration on TelegramQuote: "This morning, at about 05:00, the enemy used ballistic weapons to launch a missile attack on Kyiv.
This is the third ballistic missile attack on the capital in August, with a clear interval of 6 days between the attacks!
The preliminary data shows that the ballistic missiles were shot down on approach to the capital."
Details: Popko also said that almost simultaneously with the ballistic missiles, several Russian attack UAVs were flying towards Kyiv.

title: X shuts Brazil operations over  censorship  orders : Musk – DW – 08 / 18 / 2024
message:
A feud between X owner Elon Musk and a Brazilian top court judge has culminated in the platform shutting down its local operations for the staff’s "safety."
In April, Moraes had ordered an investigation into Musk, accusing him of "criminal instrumentalization" of the platform.
"Alexandre de Moraes threatened our legal representative in Brazil with arrest if we do not comply with his censorship orders.
The post said X's numerous appeals went unheard at the court while the public was not informed of the orders.
The decision to close down local operations was taken to protect the safety of the staff, it said.
